intro: Uapaca somon, commonly known as the African velvetbean, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Uapaca somon thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts across its native range.
